languageKey.label: The IPSV
About

The Integrated Public Sector Vocabulary (IPSV) is a structured list of terms for the Subject metadata of public sector resources. Use of the IPSV is part of the compliance requirements for the e-Government Metadata Standard.
The IPSV was formed from three taxonomies: the Government Category List (GCL), which was owned by the Cabinet Office, the Local Government Category List (LGCL), owned by esd-toolkit, and the seamlessUK taxonomy, owned by Essex County Council. The IPSV’s detailed coverage of community information and local authority services reflects the focus of the latter two parent taxonomies.
The IPSV contains about 8000 terms and is used largely by public sector websites in Britain.
Read more about the IPSV at: http://www.esd.org.uk/standards/ipsv/
Path to csv-file
Path on the server where import-file can be found. Use 'EXT:' to specify a path inside an extension.
Prefix original id
The original id of the category will be prefixed with this string and stored with the record.
Action

Determines which kind of action should be performed. Select Import if a clean import should be performed. Select Update if you already did an import and only want to update the records. The script will check if a record already exists in this path before it creates a new one.
